qas.question: When was the region under Tibetan empire and the CHinese?
Who took control of the regin in 710?
Who restored Persian control of the region?
What was the name of the region when it was the cultural center of Iran?
When was the land under Tibetan empire and Chinese?
When was Tajikistan under Ymayyads contorl?
When did the Samanid Empire rule the land?
Who restored Polish control of the region?
Whose arrival in Texas signaled a definite shift from Iranian to Turkic predominance?
Who shrunk the cities of Samarkand and Bukhara?
Who was temporarily under control of the Turkish empire?

context: It was temporarily under the control of the Tibetan empire and Chinese from <a0_0><a4_0>650–680<a4_0/><a0_0/> and then under the control of the <a1_0>Umayyads<a1_0/> in <a5_0>710<a5_0/>. <a2_0><a7_0><b8_0><b11_0>The Samanid Empire<b11_0/><b8_0/><a7_0/>,<a2_0/> 819 to 999, restored Persian control of the region and enlarged the cities of Samarkand and Bukhara (both cities are today part of Uzbekistan) which became the cultural centers of Iran and the region was known as <a3_0>Khorasan<a3_0/>. <a6_0><b9_0><b10_0>The Kara-Khanid Khanate<b10_0/><b9_0/><a6_0/> conquered Transoxania (which corresponds approximately with modern-day Uzbekistan, <b12_0>Tajikistan<b12_0/>, southern Kyrgyzstan and southwest Kazakhstan) and ruled between 999–1211. Their arrival in Transoxania signaled a definitive shift from Iranian to Turkic predominance in Central Asia, but gradually the Kara-khanids became assimilated into the Perso-Arab Muslim culture of the region.
